content: Yes, the UK is actively engaged in ongoing trade negotiations with several countries. Some of the countries the UK has recently announced it intends to negotiate trade deals with include India, Mexico, and Brazil. The UK government has also expressed interest in joining the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), a trade agreement between several countries including Japan, Canada, Australia, and New Zealand. Negotiations to join the CPTPP are currently ongoing, with the UK government stating that membership in the agreement would support growth and investment opportunities and help to "make Britain a hub for tech and services trade". Additionally, the UK government has noted that it intends to pursue trade talks with countries in Africa and the Middle East, and potentially other markets in Asia and the Americas.
